  • Uses of Location in game

    Methods in game with parameters of type Location
    Modifier and Type Method Description
    Actions Bushes.allowableActions​(Actor actor, Location location, java.lang.String direction)
    Returns the actions that the player can do to the bush and here it is only picking fruits from the bush.
    Actions Lake.allowableActions​(Actor actor, Location location, java.lang.String direction)
    Allows the player to interact with this lake and use the fish action on it once it is next to the lake
    Actions SwitchMap.allowableActions​(Actor actor, Location location, java.lang.String direction)
    the action for the player to move between the maps.
    Actions Tree.allowableActions​(Actor actor, Location location, java.lang.String direction)
    A method to check if the tree has fruits for the player to pick
    Actions VendingMachine.allowableActions​(Actor actor, Location location, java.lang.String direction)
    A method that calls an instance of VendingAction for the player to access the vending machine.
    int FollowBehaviour.distance​(Location a, Location b)
    Compute the Manhattan distance between two locations.
    int SearchBehaviour.distance​(Location a, Location b)
    Compute the Manhattan distance between two locations.
    void Tree.dropsFruit​(Location location)
    A method to drop a ripe fruit from the tree onto the ground.
    Action Dinosaur.findFood​(GameMap map, Location targetLocation)
    calls the required behaviours of the dinosaur for it to find Food, the behaviour checks all the attributes of the dinosaur and whether or not the requirements for it to find Food are met, and returns the action for the dinosaur to find Food and if requirements are not met returns null.
    Action Dinosaur.findLake​(GameMap map, Location targetLocation)
    calls the searching behaviour of the dinosaur when it needs to find a lake to drink or eat from, flying dinosaurs can drink like a normal dinosaur and while eat eats fish, this returns the action for the dinosaur to find a lake and if requirements are not met returns null.
    void Egg.hatch​(Location currentLocation)
    keeps incrementing the counter for when the egg is on the floor when called by the tick function every turn and when the egg has been on the floor for the required amount of turns the egg will hatch and a new instance of a dinosaur of the same species as the egg will be created on the same location the egg hatched at.
    void Bushes.killBush​(Location location)
    checks whether a brachiosaur is on this bush and is called on every turn if there is a brachiosaur on the bush there is 50% chance that the bush dies.
    Fruit Tree.produceFruit​(Location location)
    A method to produce a fruit.
    boolean Tree.ripening​(Location location)
    A method to randomly determine whether the tree produces a fruit.
    void Fruit.rot​(Location currentLocation)
    will remove the fruit from the map when it rots
    void Bushes.tick​(Location location)
    the passage of time for this bush through each turn and what the bush does in each turn, it only tries to ripen a fruit on each turn, and it checks if a brachiosaur currently stepped on it and will have a 50% chance to kill the bush.
    void DinoCorpse.tick​(Location currentLocation)
    provides the passage of time on the corpse as its on the map, it will increment the number of turns the corpse was on the map for and will call the decay function to remove the corpse once the required number of turns for the corpse to rot is met.
    void Dirt.tick​(Location location)
    provides the passage of time on the dirt and checks if it is possible for the dirt to grow a bush in the turn, if the probability to grow is met then it will create and set a bush on the location this dirt is on.
    void Egg.tick​(Location currentLocation)
    provides the passage of time for the egg once its on the floor and keeps calling the hatch function every turn to see if the egg can hatch
    void Fruit.tick​(Location currentLocation)
    provides the passage of time to the fruit object and checks if its on the floor, if it has been on the floor for over the required amount of turns it will rot.
    void Fruit.tick​(Location currentLocation, Actor actor)
    the passage of time of when the fruit exists in the players inventory, the fruit will pause to rot while it is in the players inventory and will heal for more when it is fed to a dinosaur
    void Lake.tick​(Location location)
    every turn the lake has a chance for the rain to
    void MeatMealKit.tick​(Location currentLocation)
    Another tick function.
